More delny and trouble
at the Syrian frontiez. Our visas vere for a sángle trip and

was 12.
We had to pay 20 Syrian pounde (about 36.00) and

The casite can only be appreciated by
seeing it and going through it. Neither of us realised before
this trip hou long the Crusaders vere in this part of the world.
Krak des Chavaliers wes hold by them for more than 150 years.
During
that time they were constantly making it stronger. I$
stands on
the top of a zooky eminence in a fertile valleyt
perhaps 400 feet above the valley floor.
It consists of a deep
most all the way around, then an outer wall trenty feet thiok
and 30 feet high. Then another inner moat and then the castle
reached through a single entaance over a draw indige.
The whole
oastle is remarkable well preserved, considering that it is over
850 years old.
Part of it is four stories high with capacity
for a garrison of 4000 men.
The pots in which they stored the
oil to throw flaning hot an the attackers are still in taot.
During the 162 yeaza this seemingly imprognable fortress obanged
hands a number of times ending up with the Hospitallers. It
was attaciced a number of times. Besieged by Saladdin in 1188
but he thought better of the idea and went sournd it to capture
all the other strong points. and more or less destroy the Krak
by laolating it. Pinally, however, some 83 Jeurs later 1t fell
to a Noslen king, the guide book doenn't say how but I think
the commander who lost it hhould have been court martialled.
The history
says that the conquerozs were most lenient and with
no further knowledge thain that I suspet that the Crusaders
vere fed up and made a deal.
The Crusaders were not without
their influnce in this community. Today you nee lote of blonde

Today ve sort of jelled on future plans.
hoped to 60 to Taharan, Iran and from there to Afghanastan but
Its winter there and then too Teharan is 8000º and that altitude

So rather reluotantly we have a

Then to Honolulu to arrive around the 20th of Jeo,

HMB
